etymologies: early 18th century: modern Latin, from Greek anaisthēsia, from an- ‘without’ + aisthēsis ‘sensation’

definitions: insensitivity to pain, especially as artificially induced by the administration of gases or the injection of drugs before surgical operations

examples.text: during anesthesia body temperature falls due to the effect of drugs
modern clinical anesthesia uses low concentrations of volatile anesthetics

shortDefinitions: insensitivity to pain induced before surgical operations
